page.title: 03POLLUTION IN STREAMS
page.content: AN EXAMINATION OF THE STREAMS RUNNING THROUGH THE FAVERDALE HOUSING ESTATE PRODUCED AN INTERESTING CONTRAST.THE FIRST STREAM WE EXAMINED ENTERED THE HOUSING ESTATE AFTER PASSING THROUGH THE GROUNDS OF THE CHEMICAL WORKS.AFTER SEVERAL ATTEMPTS TO FIND LIFE IN THIS STREAM WE FOUND IT HAD NO LIFE WHAT SO EVER LIVING IN IT. THIS INDICATED TO US THAT IT WAS SO POLLUTED THAT NOTHING COULD LIVE IN IT.WE THEN EXAMINED ANOTHER STREAM RUNNING ALONG THE EDGE OF THE ESTATE WHICH RAN INTO THE ESTATE FROM THE COUNTRYSIDE.WE DID FIND SOME LIFE IN THIS STREAM AND APPLIED THE FOLLOWING GUIDE TO SEE HOW POLLUTED IT WAS. THESE CREATURES BEING INDICATORS OF LEVELS OF POLLUTION.NO LIFE-COMPLETELY POLLUTED RAT-TAILED MAGGOT OR SLUDGE WORM VERY POLLUTED WATER HOG LOUSE OR BLOOD WORM-QUITE POLLUTED CADDIS FLY
